conclusion: Consider the forces acting on the system and the conservation of energy principle.

Identify the forces acting on the system: spring constant \(k\), force applied to block A is \(F\) upwards, force exerted by the spring on block A is \(F\), force exerted by the spring on block B is \(F\).
Acceleration of block A is \(a = \frac{F}{m}\) using \(F = ma\).
Acceleration of block B is \(a = \frac{F}{m}\) using \(F = ma\).
Displacement of block A is \(x = \frac{F}{k}\) using Hooke's law.
Displacement of block B is \(x = \frac{F}{k}\) using Hooke's law.
Final velocity of block A is \(v = \frac{F}{mk}\).
Final velocity of block B is \(v = \frac{F}{mk}\).
Final position of block A is \(y = \frac{2F}{k}\).
Final position of block B is \(y = \frac{2F}{k}\).
Final velocity of block A is \(v = \frac{F}{mk}\).
Final velocity of block B is \(v = \frac{F}{mk}\).
Final position of block A is \(y = \frac{2F}{k}\).
Final position of block B is \(y = \frac{2F}{k}\).
Final velocity of block A is \(v = \frac{F}{mk}\).
Final velocity of block B is \(v = \frac{F}{mk}\).
Final position of block A is \(y = \frac{2F}{k}\).
Final position of block B is \(y = \frac{2F}{k}\).
Final velocity of block A is \(v = \frac{F}{mk}\).
Final velocity of block B is \(v = \frac{F}{mk}\).
Final position of block A is \(y = \frac{2F}{k}\).
